Let X, Y, X', Y' be random variables.

Is there a lemma to prove that if X and Y are independent (IndepFun) and the pair (X, Y)( i.e. fun ω ↦ (X ω, Y ω)) is identically distributed (IdentDistrib) to the pair (X', Y') then X' and Y' are independent?

One might be able to get this from pfr#ProbabilityTheory.indepFun_iff_map_prod_eq_prod_map_map' docs#ProbabilityTheory.IdentDistrib.map_eq and docs#ProbabilityTheory.IdentDistrib.comp . It sounds like a lemma that could be worth putting into Mathlib though (as far as I can see it doesn't exist there yet).
Thanks a lot! We have proved it and opened #13125 on Mathlib to add it as indepFun_of_identDistrib_pair.
Pietro Monticone has marked this topic as resolved.
